Description:
For 27 years, Joseph Vance Architects has been designing high end, custom residential projects - brownstone/townhouse gut renovations, lofts, rooftop additions and conversions of manufacturing buildings to residential. We are a small group of creative problem solvers with a taste for well-crafted design. We value hard work to continuously grow and evolve, pushing boundaries until a project is the best it can be.

Current projects include a ground up new 6 story townhouse in the Upper West Side (with a new basketball court beneath), a gut renovation of a townhouse in Chelsea including a totally new facade, a 6,000sf triplex in a new West Village development, and others.

We are currently seeking an Intermediate Project Architect to join our ranks.

As a member of our team, you will manage your own projects under the direction of the principal, and with the support of the office as needed to help meet deadlines. The format of our firm is such that everyone is expected to run his/her own jobs - generating designs, presentations and drawings, researching codes, managing schedules, and coordinating with clients, contractors, expeditors, city agencies, vendors, consultants, etc. throughout the entire process of the project from initial client meetings to punch-list closeout. The nature of our business requires immense organization, efficiency, and commitment, but we also maintain a very stable work/life balance.

Ideally you have experience in residential architecture in NYC, some knowledge of NYC DOB and LPC, have worked with 3D modeling/BIM software and the adobe creative suite. We also expect you to have a great design sensibility and critical thinking skills, along with 4-8 years of professional experience.

If this sounds like you, then please submit a pdf of your cover letter, resume, and work sample. This is a full time salaried position with medical coverage (no part-time or freelance work). We look forward to hearing from you and appreciate your interest in our firm!

This is a full time salaried position with benefits (no part-time or freelance positions). Qualified candidates are currently living in the tri-state area and should submit a resume, work samples and salary requirements via .pdf.

Title: Architectural Lighting Designer
Description:
Tirschwell & Co. Inc | Lighting Designer Position

Profile
Architectural lighting design firm is looking for a full-time Lighting Designer who is keen to detail and has relevant work experience in Residential and Commercial lighting designs. 

Candidate should be well organized, resourceful, dedicated and have excellent written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills. Candidate should aspire to rise in their profession and witness their projects come to life, in person. Candidate should prefer a non-stressed work lifestyle and bourbon as their go-to drink.

Qualifications
The position of Lighting Designer requires exceptional architectural and lighting knowledge from both academia and professional experience. 
A degree in Architecture, engineering, interior, or lighting design is preferred.
Work experience in residential and commercial projects with an understanding and interest in lighting design.
•	Superb AutoCAD (not Vectorworks) and Adobe Suite skills. 
•	Working knowledge of Sketchup and AGI.
•	Appreciation for design and an exceptional eye for detail. 
•	Ability to problem solve and make decisions based on many different conditions. 
•	Excellent communication skills. 

The candidate must be legal to work in the United States from day one. 

Responsibilities
The designer will join several top lighting designers working on extremely high-end residential, corporate, hospitality, and landscape projects 
•	Work collaboratively as a team-member of TLD on multiple projects. 
•	Actively participate in all levels of design, from research to completion. 
•	Produce lighting designs via CAD layouts, including lighting details, light fixture specifications, mock-ups, renderings, and lighting control specifications. 
•	Engage in the final aiming of lighting fixtures and programming lighting controls at the project site. 

Summary
At TLD we want you to be the best you. Our mission is to see our vision come into actuality while giving you the opportunity to build yourself up in the lighting sector. If you have an excellent resume, meet the above requirements and ready to make a change to a company that values what you bring to the table, we would be thrilled to speak with you.

Title: Residential Interior Designer+Project Manager w/10 min 10 yrs exp
Description:
Residential Interior Designer+Project Manager- NYC Co-op, Condo and house Renovations

The job requires experience designing and managing residential interior renovations ranging from complete home and apartment interiors to combining units to  kitchens and baths. Also requires proficiency in either SketchUp, Autocad, 20/20 or other design software. An essential component of the job will be excellent and frequent communication with the client, The ideal candidate will know how to maintain good rapport with clients and be experienced enough to trouble-shoot and resolve problems quickly.

Design sales work will include meeting our clients at their home/apartment and subsequently, designing, writing work scopes, meeting and guiding clients through product selections at our and other product showrooms. Creating products lists. Ongoing support. After that, project management work will include scheduling, daily site visits, coordinating and supervising trades and product deliveries, client interactions, timely completions. You'll be running the project as the head of our team.

Hours include some evening and weekend appointments.

Real opportunities for advancement!
We are growing fast and are have a great location.


Compensation: High commission based-paid as a steady weekly income. Also phone reimbursement, $200 monthly general reimbursement and potential bonuses.

employment type: full-time

Small, reputable midtown Manhattan-based residential interior remodeling firm is looking for professional, personable Designer/Project Managers with a minimum of 10 years in residential renovation/interior design AND at least 5 years of project management experience. We are looking for Designer-project Managers who can design, sell and manage full individual Co-op and Condo apartment/house interior and kitchen/bath renovation projects. Min 6 years on-site field experience, including at least 12 projects in Manhattan or other major city and able to supervise the trades in the field. Prefer NYC resident or within 45 minutes commute.

Our projects range in price from 40k to 600k+.

We make it much easier for homeowners to have work done. We design the rooms, shop with clients for the products, order and then renovate complete apartment and house interiors, kitchens and bathrooms for individual owners of coops, condo apartments and townhouses in the mid-to-high end range.
Compensation: Weekly high paying commission-per each active project. Range from 55k to 90k

Title: INTERMEDIATE PROJECT ARCHITECT
Description:
For 27 years, Joseph Vance Architects has been designing high end, custom residential projects - brownstone/townhouse gut renovations, lofts, rooftop additions and conversions of manufacturing buildings to residential. We are a small group of creative problem solvers with a taste for well-crafted design. We value hard work to continuously grow and evolve, pushing boundaries until a project is the best it can be.

Current projects include a ground up new 6 story townhouse in the Upper West Side (with a new basketball court beneath), a gut renovation of a townhouse in Chelsea including a totally new facade, a 6,000sf triplex in a new West Village development, and others.

We are currently seeking an Intermediate Project Architect to join our ranks.

As a member of our team, you will manage your own projects under the direction of the principal, and with the support of the office as needed to help meet deadlines. The format of our firm is such that everyone is expected to run his/her own jobs - generating designs, presentations and drawings, researching codes, managing schedules, and coordinating with clients, contractors, expeditors, city agencies, vendors, consultants, etc. throughout the entire process of the project from initial client meetings to punch-list closeout. The nature of our business requires immense organization, efficiency, and commitment, but we also maintain a very stable work/life balance.

Ideally you have experience in residential architecture in NYC, some knowledge of NYC DOB and LPC, have worked with 3D modeling/BIM software and the adobe creative suite. We also expect you to have a great design sensibility and critical thinking skills, along with 4-8 years of professional experience.

If this sounds like you, then please submit a pdf of your cover letter, resume, and work sample. This is a full time salaried position with medical coverage (no part-time or freelance work). We look forward to hearing from you and appreciate your interest in our firm!

This is a full time salaried position with benefits (no part-time or freelance positions). Qualified candidates are currently living in the tri-state area and should submit a resume, work samples and salary requirements via .pdf.

Expediting company seeks experienced full time NYC DOB Expediter/Project Manager for work in the five boroughs of New York City.

- The ability to speak clear
- Strong organization skills
- Be fluent in English
- Valid driver's license

- Be able to work with a team

**** If you do not possess a Class 1 or 2 Filing Rep Status, have knowledge of required DOB/DEP/Landmarks and FDNY forms (DOT is a plus), and you cannot read a set of drawings, please do not apply for this job. We will ask you questions pertaining to forms and applications.

Please respond with your resume and your salary requirements. We look forward to hearing from you. 

We are not looking for Drafters or Architects. Thank you.

Title: Floor Plan Measurer: AS-BUILT Drawings $50/hr
Description:
We have an immediate opening for a floor plan measurer. This is a flexible position for part-time work (contractor). You will set your own schedule and we will fit appointments into your availability (M-F, 9-5 only).

Applicant must use a laser tape measure on-site.

Applicant must:
- Have a good understanding of building construction
- Be highly-proficient in CAD
- Have availability during normal weekday business hours: 9-5 to survey properties (please do not apply if you are looking for after-hour or weekend appointments.)
- Have own vehicle to visit properties
- Be reliable and very detail oriented

There are no set number of measurements in a day or week as appointments vary from week to week. We prefer a candidate with lots of availability but can set up as many or as few appointments as desired. This is a great, flexible opportunity for the right candidate.

Compensation: $50 per hr plus $10 travel and $10 per diem

Title: Facade / Building Envelope Structural Engineer
Description:
, New York City's leading professional firm dedicated to the preservation of buildings and infrastructure, is seeking a resourceful, skilled structural engineer with 3 to 7 years of building envelope restoration experience to join us in executing a growing slate of challenging projects. 

We work on an array of building types, including courthouses, schools, universities, churches, and hospitals, and many of New York's most storied landmarks, from Trinity Church to Grand Central Terminal. Our work embraces all components of the building envelope and underlying structure—facades, roofs, windows, and plazas—and the full complement of materials, from historic terra-cotta to high-performance curtain walls. We’re proud to be an industry leader in crucial practice areas like Local Law 11 inspections and repairs. We've won numerous awards, as well as the loyalty of many of the premier public, corporate, and residential clients in the region. 

You’ll work as part of a small team assigned to projects based on synergies between project requirements and the capabilities of each team member. This arrangement offers employees the dual advantages of a small office experience coupled with access to the centralized resources of a larger firm. You'll be supported by some of the most sophisticated technology in the profession, including proprietary computer systems and applications, advanced photography and image processing, and state-of-the-art, non-destructive diagnostic equipment and techniques. 

Typically, you’ll participate in all phases of a project from inception through completion: proposal, investigation, construction documents, bid negotiation, and construction administration. You'll have the opportunity to see your designs executed in the field and you'll take on greater responsibility and client management as soon as you are ready. 

We offer an array of benefits and growth opportunities: :


Our light-filled Tribeca office is in a landmarked building with 16' high ceilings, 8' tall windows, and stunning views of Manhattan in three directions—not a bad place to spend the work day. We’re easily accessible via public transportation: the A, C, and E Canal Street station connects directly to our building’s lobby. The N, R, 1, and 6 lines are all just a few blocks away. 

If you’re excited about this opportunity, please send us your resume, a cover letter with salary requirements, and a few pages of attachments (maximum of 10MB, please) or link to your portfolio that demonstrates your experience and capabilities. 

With thanks for your interest, please note that only those candidates under consideration will be contacted. 

For additional information on our firm’s services, approach, and projects, visit

We offer an array of benefits and growth opportunities: :


Our light-filled Tribeca office is in a landmarked building with 16' high ceilings, 8' tall windows, and stunning views of Manhattan in three directions—not a bad place to spend the work day. Title: Signal Engineer
Description:
Tectonic is currently seeking full-time Signal Engineers to work on various building and infrastructure for upcoming MTA projects in the New York City area.

This position will provide Signal Engineers with the chance to work on high profile, challenging projects that offer the opportunity for professional growth and advancement within the A/E/C industry working for a Top ENR 500 Firm. 

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

The essential functions of this position include traveling to various project sites on a daily basis and perform daily surveillance and inspections to verify that all work performed by the Contractor has been completed in accordance with the contract requirements, along with being responsible to ensure quality hold points are being observed and witness all applicable inspection and testing required under the Contract. The Signal Engineer will access and conduct field inspection to enforce NYCT rules and regulations involving the daily field construction need and to ensure contractors are incompliance with all pre-requisite for the work tasks being performed in the field, as well as proper and safe working environment are set up and field works are adequately covered. Such pre-requisite will include but not limited to approve drawings, materials, obtain proper permits and procure NYCT support services such as flagging protection, G.O. and work trains. The Engineer will discuss and coordinate work activities with contractors and field inspectors and will review and ensure that daily reports are properly and accurately recorded with details. Essential functions also include the preparation of Daily Field Reports, communication of deficiencies observed in the field to project managers, contractors, and/or client representatives, and the interpretation of project-related drawings and documents, as well as all other duties as assigned. Field inspectors will prepare detailed daily inspection reports and records all contractor and NYCT personnel on site, work performed, materials used and any incidents and non-conformances occurred in the field.

TO VIEW AND APPLY, PLEASE VISIT: 

QUALIFICATIONS

•	Candidates must possess the following certifications AND a High School Diploma/equivalent:
o	OSHA 30 Hour Safety 
o	Lead Awareness
•	Ability to complete Track Safety and PMG 123 Training Certification;
•	Effective oral and written communication skills; 
•	Must be detail oriented;
•	A valid, clean driver’s license and personal vehicle to travel to job sites is preferred; as regular daily travel is required to various project sites primarily throughout the New York City metro area; 

COMPETITIVE SALARY AND BENEFITS PACKAGE
•	Comprehensive group medical insurance, including health, dental, vision and life
•	Opportunities for professional growth and advancement
•	Tuition reimbursement
•	Paid time off, including vacation, sick and personal
•	Company–observed paid holidays
•	Short and long-term disability coverage
•	Flexible spending accounts for medical expenses and dependent care
•	Commuter benefit plan for public transportation costs
•	401K retirement and profit sharing plan.

We are an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer, and highly encourage resumes from all interested parties including women, minorities, veterans and persons with disabilities. All qualified applicants will be afforded equal employment opportunities without discrimination on the basis of race, creed, color, national origin, sex, age, disability, marital status, or any other protected class.
Tectonic participates in the USCIS E-Verify Program to verify that all new hires are authorized to work in the United States.

Title: Facade / Building Envelope Architect
Description:
, New York City's leading professional firm dedicated to the preservation of buildings and infrastructure, is seeking a resourceful, skilled architect with 2 to 5 years of building envelope restoration experience to join us in executing a growing slate of challenging projects. 

We work on an array of building types, including courthouses, schools, universities, churches, and hospitals, and many of New York's most storied landmarks, from Trinity Church to Grand Central Terminal. Our work embraces all components of the building envelope and underlying structure—facades, roofs, windows, and plazas—and the full complement of materials, from historic terra-cotta to high-performance curtain walls. We’re proud to be an industry leader in crucial practice areas like Local Law 11 inspections and repairs. We've won numerous awards, as well as the loyalty of many of the premier public, corporate, and residential clients in the region. 

You’ll work as part of a small team assigned to projects based on synergies between project requirements and the capabilities of each team member. This arrangement offers employees the dual advantages of a small office experience coupled with access to the centralized resources of a larger firm. You'll be supported by some of the most sophisticated technology in the profession, including proprietary computer systems and applications, advanced photography and image processing, and state-of-the-art, non-destructive diagnostic equipment and techniques. 

Typically, you’ll participate in all phases of a project from inception through completion: proposal, investigation, construction documents, bid negotiation, and construction administration. You'll have the opportunity to see your designs executed in the field and you'll take on greater responsibility and client management as soon as you are ready. 

We offer an array of benefits and growth opportunities: :


Our light-filled Tribeca office is in a landmarked building with 16' high ceilings, 8' tall windows, and stunning views of Manhattan in three directions—not a bad place to spend the work day. We’re easily accessible via public transportation: the A, C, and E Canal Street station connects directly to our building’s lobby. The N, R, 1, and 6 lines are all just a few blocks away. 

If you’re excited about this opportunity, please send us your resume, a cover letter with salary requirements, and a few pages of attachments (maximum of 10MB, please) or link to your portfolio that demonstrates your experience and capabilities. 

With thanks for your interest, please note that only those candidates under consideration will be contacted. 

For additional information on our firm’s services, approach, and projects, visit

Title: Senior Mechanical Engineer (9+ years)
Description:
Do you want to help develop a pioneering solution to one of the biggest healthcare problem facing our country?   

We are a tech-startup (funded initially by NIH) looking for experienced mechanical engineers. 

**We will only consider candidates with 9+ years at med-tech / pharma**

About the Senior Mechanical Engineer role:
Required - do not apply unless you have 
•	9+ years of work in a regulated industry (specifically medical devices) and regulatory documentation
•	7+ years of proven product design and project management experience
•	7+ years of experience working with contract manufacturers (domestic and international)

The ideal candidate will display the commitment and dedication necessary to guide complex projects, as well as the capacity to take ownership of tasks and proactively oversee all resources involved. You will work with an internal team of electrical, mechanical, and software engineers, while working with suppliers and healthcare professionals to carry our products from problem statement through to large-scale production.
 
Candidates must be able to work quickly, seamlessly shift between technical requirements and non-technical explanations, and think outside of the box to find simple solutions to complex engineering issues. A successful candidate will have the ability to scrutinize every dimension of a mechanical system, while also ensuring all decisions are made towards the goal of achieving our broader product vision as an integral part of our business development strategy. Candidates must be familiar with good documentation practices as well as the various steps necessary to bring a regulated product to market, this includes FMEA, GDT, V&V, QA, QC, Design, Simulations, and Prototyping. Visa sponsorship is not available for this position.

 
Qualifications:
•	Experience launching a high-volume consumer electronic device
•	MS in mechanical engineering; PMP preferred
•	Strong foundation in mechanical engineering concepts
•	Fluency in Solidworks for 3D modeling and FEA simulation
•	Thorough knowledge of GMP (Good Manufacturing Practices)
•	Excellent technical writing skills and documentation practices
 
Additional Qualifications (nice-to-haves):
•	Previous medical device and/or pharmaceutical experience preferred
•	Understanding of the current regulatory requirements as per FDA and ISO guidelines for medical devices
•	Experience launching multiple high volume products
•	Experience with waterproofing and IPXX
•	Experience with designing robotics systems on the cm/mm-scale
 
Responsibilities:
•	Lead a structured product development effort, from start to finish.
•	Schedule preparation and planning (Gantt charts)
•	Resource forecasting
•	Tracking engineer availability and overall project status
•	Enforcement of project timelines and budgets
•	Design mechanical and electromechanical system to meet product goals.
•	3D model, built, test, and refine prototypes while considering how they would scale to medium and high volumes.
•	Facilitate communication at regular intervals between management, engineers, and regulatory team.
 
A portfolio showcasing thoughtful design engineering strongly preferred, but not required. If you will be submitting a portfolio, please share it as a link in your note when you apply.

Salary and option package commensurate with experience and skill set.

Schedule Construction, Plumbing, Electrical inspections

Download Pass - Final Reports and submit for sign-off

1. DOT Permits: Sidewalk, Fire Hydrant, Curb Cut

1. Attend ECB hearings
2. Process penalty payments

1. Street Address Verification

1. Submit applications

"	Knowledge of Microsoft Word and Excel

 is an educational enrichment company that introduces children in grades K-8 to STEM concepts using LEGO® components.

Title: Facade / Building Envelope Project Architect
Description:
, New York City's leading professional firm dedicated to the preservation of buildings and infrastructure, is seeking a resourceful, skilled architect with 5 to 10 years of building envelope restoration experience to join us in executing a growing slate of challenging projects. 

We work on an array of building types, including courthouses, schools, universities, churches, and hospitals, and many of New York's most storied landmarks, from Trinity Church to Grand Central Terminal. Our work embraces all components of the building envelope and underlying structure—facades, roofs, windows, and plazas—and the full complement of materials, from historic terra-cotta to high-performance curtain walls. We’re proud to be an industry leader in crucial practice areas like Local Law 11 inspections and repairs. We've won numerous awards, as well as the loyalty of many of the premier public, corporate, and residential clients in the region. 

You’ll work as part of a small team assigned to projects based on synergies between project requirements and the capabilities of each team member. This arrangement offers employees the dual advantages of a small office experience coupled with access to the centralized resources of a larger firm. You'll be supported by some of the most sophisticated technology in the profession, including proprietary computer systems and applications, advanced photography and image processing, and state-of-the-art, non-destructive diagnostic equipment and techniques. 

Typically, you’ll participate in all phases of a project from inception through completion: proposal, investigation, construction documents, bid negotiation, and construction administration. You'll have the opportunity to see your designs executed in the field and you'll take on greater responsibility and client management as soon as you are ready. 

We offer an array of benefits and growth opportunities: :


Our light-filled Tribeca office is in a landmarked building with 16' high ceilings, 8' tall windows, and stunning views of Manhattan in three directions—not a bad place to spend the work day. We’re easily accessible via public transportation: the A, C, and E Canal Street station connects directly to our building’s lobby. The N, R, 1, and 6 lines are all just a few blocks away. 

If you’re excited about this opportunity, please send us your resume, a cover letter with salary requirements, and a few pages of attachments (maximum of 10MB, please) or link to your portfolio that demonstrates your experience and capabilities. 

With thanks for your interest, please note that only those candidates under consideration will be contacted. 

For additional information on our firm’s services, approach, and projects, visit

-Assisting PM to fall within project schedule and budget
-Handling all RFIs and RFPs, submittals, and shop drawings
-Handling project close outs and punch list items
-Processing paperwork for the NYC Dept. of Buildings
-Some estimating and purchasing
-Strong written/verbal skills

At least 2-3 years experience. Knowledge in MS Projects, Word, Excel, and Outlook a must. Ability to read architectural plans also a must. Driver's license a plus. This position is an immediate start.

Title: Structural Engineer
Description:
Job Description:

We are currently seeking structural engineers at multiple levels to join our team. As a structural engineer, you will work with other team members in our highly collaborative environment to assure that designs are developed in accordance with appropriate codes and standards, quality control objectives are achieved, and project goals are met within the schedule and budget. This is an outstanding opportunity for a structural engineer to work on a variety of high-profile projects throughout the region. 

Duties and Responsibilities:

- Coordinate with architects, contractors, owners, and other engineers from the initial planning stages through final construction.
- Determine design criteria using relevant codes and standards.
- Analyze and/or prepare models and calculations for various structural elements and systems by using various software and/or hand calculations.
- Develop contract documents, including construction drawings and technical specifications
- Produce schematic and detailed designs and evaluation of planning and concept alternatives
- Review shop drawings, RFI's.
- Perform field inspections and write inspection reports.

Skills and Qualifications:

- Familiar with latest version of AutoCAD, Revit, ETABS, SAP2000, SAFE, RAM, Excel.
- Excellent verbal and written communication skills
- Ability to effectively work independently and collaboratively in a team environment
- Must be eligible to work in the United States

Entry Level Candidates:
- Bachelor’s degree in Civil or Structural Engineering.

Intermediate Level Candidates:
- Master’s degree in Civil or Structural Engineering.
- 3+ years of related work experience in concrete or steel framing building structural design, support-of-excavation and foundation system design, steel or concrete rebar shop drawing design, construction support design and field inspection.

Advance Level Candidates:
- Master’s degree in Civil or Structural Engineering.
- 8+ years of related work experience in concrete or steel framing building structural design, support-of-excavation and foundation system design, steel or concrete rebar shop drawing design, construction support design and field inspection.
- NYS PE License
Compensation: The salary is based on level of experience.

Title: PROFESSIONAL ENGINEERS
Architectural Designer
Description:
Seeking an architectural designer to work in a dynamic, diverse and design-focused environment. 

This position will give the right applicants the opportunity to participate in all phases of a high end, design-oriented residential, commercial and retail projects from start to finish. The position involves working directly with the principals and depending on the level of experience may work directly with contractors, consultants, and clients. 

We are looking for the right candidates to grow with the firm and expand their responsibilities.


Job Responsibilities: 
- Participate and contribute to design discussion, idea generation and design work in drawing, model and 3D image formats. 
- Work with the principals and project managers on different phases of the project. 
- Responsible for preparing presentation drawings and models and developing designs and technical solutions throughout all phases of the project. 
- Generate revisions and corrections from outline mock-ups, redline drawings and project document sets. 
- Manage data on various cloud based platforms and related file sharing sites. 
- Work on misc. presentation materials for the office.

Requirements:
- Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in architecture required.
- Knowledge of AutoCAD and/or Vectorworks. Working knowledge of Photoshop, In Design and Illustrator.
- Knowledge of commercial/retail construction desired.
- Ability to read and interpret construction plans and technical drawings. 
- Strong design skills and ability to think "outside the box".
- Minimum of 1-2 years recent and relevant architectural experience required. Experience in NYC architectural offices preferred.
- Construction administration experience beneficial.
- Technical knowledge and detailing skills beneficial.
- Strong oral and written communication skills.
- Ability to work in a fast-paced work environment to produce deliverables on time with little to no guidance, while working on multiple simultaneous projects. 
- Excellent intrapersonal skills and good vibes.
- Must be a US Citizen, green card holder and/or have a US visa for legal work in US  
- Only candidates who submit work samples will be considered.
Compensation: Please include a resume, hourly salary expectations when responding and work samples should be in PDF format (optimized please!).

Title: Architect
Description:
Established mid-sized NYC architectural firm is seeking Architects to join our dynamic, multi-disciplinary team. Applicants should be highly motivated and demonstrate design sensibility and technical skills. Successful candidates will work closely with senior staff and principals on projects of various types.

- Ideally possesses good design and visualization skills with mature graphic sense

- Have strong organizational skills, communication skills, and project management skills

Title: Drafter
Description: Construction company specializing in exterior restoration will hire a draftsman assistant. Basic knowledge of Autocad necessary.

Title: Architectural Field Representative
Description:
Midtown Manhattan Architecture firm is looking for a field representative for a new school building of 67,500SF that will be starting construction this summer in the Bay Terrace neighborhood of Queens, NY.

The project is being built for the New York City School Construction Authority for completion in 2023.

The position requires 3-5 years of experience working with the School Construction Authority as a Field Representative or Project Officer. Other similar experience will be considered. The candidate should be a Registered Architect or PE and will be stationed in the School Construction Authority's on-site trailer during the work.

The position will require daily monitoring of the construction work, response to RFIs, creation of NCRs, processing of bulletins, attendance at all site meetings, including minute writing for site progress meetings. It will involve working closely with the project personnel in the Architect's home office, as well as with the School Construction Authority project officers who will occupy the construction trailer.

The candidate must be very familiar with construction documents, SCA details, procedures and protocols and have an extensive knowledge of the construction of institutional scale buildings, including architectural, structural and MEP systems. The candidate should be able to produce site sketches in AutoCAD for field conditions that arise, and be able to edit AutoCAD files for use in filing amendments with filing agencies, and for coordinating with the Architect's home office. The candidate must have OSHA safety certificates for scaffold work and site safety.

The goal of the position will be to work with the entire team to help construct and complete a large complex school building efficiently and to a high level of quality.

Title: Project Manager – Hotels and Restaurants – New York City
Description:

Responsibilities will include:

• Ensuring a schedule is in place during project set up and sub-bidding that reflects the project strategy and is sufficient for estimating and subcontractor purchasing selection.
• Developing a purchasing schedule and strategy to anticipate, address and resolve purchasing challenges during the early stages of pre-construction.
• Executing each project phase including pre-construction, construction, closeout and post-construction services.
• Working in partnership with the Project Superintendent to maintain an updated and accurate project schedule. Attending weekly meetings and keeping minutes
• Thorough completion of all financial data with an eye to quickly identify potential/existing issues that could lead to subpar financial performance.

Qualifications
• Proven advanced experience in project and construction management with a general contractor

Please email your resume and if possible, supply a list of projects you have worked on from start to finish.

Title: Plumbing/Fire Protection Engineer
Description:
We are a world-class multi-disciplinary engineering consulting firm who is seeking a Plumbing/Fire Protection Engineer for our New York, NY office. 

Responsibilities 

Our engineers work on high quality, high-profile, national and international projects. We are currently looking for engineers who will be responsible for the systems design of commercial, institutional, healthcare, and laboratory projects.

•	Specify appropriate materials and finishes as they relate to the project.

•	Review and provide details for shop drawings.

•	Assist in developing project schedule and provide data for estimating project costs.

We are looking for highly creative designers with excellent communication skills who are not afraid to use their imagination when it comes to developing concepts and ideas for dynamic projects and see them through to completion. 
 
We look forward to hearing from you.

-	When emailing portfolio keep attachments small and consolidate files into one package.
-	We regret that due to the regular very high volume of responses, unsuccessful applicants may not receive a response.

Title: Facade / Building Envelope Project Architect
Description:
, New York City's leading professional firm dedicated to the preservation of buildings and infrastructure, is seeking a resourceful, skilled architect with 5 to 10 years of building envelope restoration experience to join us in executing a growing slate of challenging projects. 

We work on an array of building types, including courthouses, schools, universities, churches, and hospitals, and many of New York's most storied landmarks, from Trinity Church to Grand Central Terminal. Our work embraces all components of the building envelope and underlying structure—facades, roofs, windows, and plazas—and the full complement of materials, from historic terra-cotta to high-performance curtain walls. We’re proud to be an industry leader in crucial practice areas like Local Law 11 inspections and repairs. We've won numerous awards, as well as the loyalty of many of the premier public, corporate, and residential clients in the region. 

You’ll work as part of a small team assigned to projects based on synergies between project requirements and the capabilities of each team member. This arrangement offers employees the dual advantages of a small office experience coupled with access to the centralized resources of a larger firm. You'll be supported by some of the most sophisticated technology in the profession, including proprietary computer systems and applications, advanced photography and image processing, and state-of-the-art, non-destructive diagnostic equipment and techniques. 

Typically, you’ll participate in all phases of a project from inception through completion: proposal, investigation, construction documents, bid negotiation, and construction administration. You'll have the opportunity to see your designs executed in the field and you'll take on greater responsibility and client management as soon as you are ready. 

We offer an array of benefits and growth opportunities: :


Our light-filled Tribeca office is in a landmarked building with 16' high ceilings, 8' tall windows, and stunning views of Manhattan in three directions—not a bad place to spend the work day. We’re easily accessible via public transportation: the A, C, and E Canal Street station connects directly to our building’s lobby. The N, R, 1, and 6 lines are all just a few blocks away. 

If you’re excited about this opportunity, please send us your resume, a cover letter with salary requirements, and a few pages of attachments (maximum of 10MB, please) or link to your portfolio that demonstrates your experience and capabilities. 

With thanks for your interest, please note that only those candidates under consideration will be contacted. 

For additional information on our firm’s services, approach, and projects, visit

Title: Mechanical Designers
Description:
Mechanical Designers are sought to join an ambitious, well-funded interdisciplinary research group based in New York City.  These hires will work on the mechanical design and construction of new generations of our custom-built ANTON® supercomputer, collaborating with our team on all phases of system development, from concept to delivery.  This is a limited-term position with an anticipated 12-month contract.

Successful candidates will have expertise in sheet metal and machined part design, including hands-on prototyping and testing of chassis and enclosures, and modeling and drafting in SolidWorks and/or PTC Creo (Pro/Engineer).  They should have a demonstrated ability to design complex, rack-based electronic packaging systems with integrated power and cooling.  Other relevant experience might include plastics design and injection molding, creating assembly drawings, and resolution of DFM/DFA issues.  Excellent analytical and communication skills are required.

We take great pride in the caliber of our team, and we offer above-market compensation to candidates of exceptional ability.

Our research effort is aimed at achieving major scientific advances in the field of biochemistry and fundamentally transforming the process of drug discovery.

To submit an application, please use the link provided below:


D. E. Shaw Research is a New York-based interdisciplinary research group pursuing an ambitious, long-term project aimed at achieving major scientific advances in the fields of biochemistry and molecular biology.  Among the group's current activities is the development of specialized supercomputers designed in part to fundamentally transform the process of drug discovery.

D. E. Shaw Research is an equal opportunity employer, dedicated to the goal of building a diverse workforce. We welcome inquiries from all exceptionally well-qualified applicants, regardless of race, color, nationality, national or ethnic origin, religion or religious belief, caste, gender, gender identity, pregnancy, caregiver status, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital or civil partner status, disability, or status in any other category protected in this regard by law in any jurisdiction in which the Firm operates.

Title: Architectural Lighting Designer
Description:
Tirschwell & Co. Inc | Lighting Designer Position

Profile
Architectural lighting design firm is looking for a full-time Lighting Designer who is keen to detail and has relevant work experience in Residential and Commercial lighting designs. 

Candidate should be well organized, resourceful, dedicated and have excellent written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills. Candidate should aspire to rise in their profession and witness their projects come to life, in person. Candidate should prefer a non-stressed work lifestyle and bourbon as their go-to drink.

Qualifications
The position of Lighting Designer requires exceptional architectural and lighting knowledge from both academia and professional experience. 
A degree in Architecture, engineering, interior, or lighting design is preferred.
Work experience in residential and commercial projects with an understanding and interest in lighting design.
•	Superb AutoCAD (not Vectorworks) and Adobe Suite skills. 
•	Working knowledge of Sketchup and AGI.
•	Appreciation for design and an exceptional eye for detail. 
•	Ability to problem solve and make decisions based on many different conditions. 
•	Excellent communication skills. 

The candidate must be legal to work in the United States from day one. 

Responsibilities
The designer will join several top lighting designers working on extremely high-end residential, corporate, hospitality, and landscape projects 
•	Work collaboratively as a team-member of TLD on multiple projects. 
•	Actively participate in all levels of design, from research to completion. 
•	Produce lighting designs via CAD layouts, including lighting details, light fixture specifications, mock-ups, renderings, and lighting control specifications. 
•	Engage in the final aiming of lighting fixtures and programming lighting controls at the project site. 

Summary
At TLD we want you to be the best you. Our mission is to see our vision come into actuality while giving you the opportunity to build yourself up in the lighting sector. If you have an excellent resume, meet the above requirements and ready to make a change to a company that values what you bring to the table, we would be thrilled to speak with you.
